newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Strong upside seen for Jackin on debut.
newsitem.headline: Strong upside seen for Jackin on debut.

text.p: Jackin International Holdings Ltd shares have strong, short-term upside potential after the initial public offering (IPO) priced at a low price earnings multiple but they may be dull performers longer term, analysts said on Tuesday.
Jackin, which is due to make its stock market debut on Thursday, offered 90.75 million shares at HK$1.05 per share.
Analysts said the grey market price was HK$1.80-HK$2.025 a share. The IPO was 257.90 times subscribed.
"A strong debut is expected due to the high grey market price and the strong subscription response," said Ben Kwong, research director at Dharmala Securities.
Analysts said a relatively low prospective weighted average and fully diluted PE of 5.0 times and 6.0 times had led to a strong response from short-term investors who were looking for quick profits.
But the company's fundamentals were unexciting, they added.
Jackin makes and sells content-based and blank information storage media products, including CD-ROMs, VCDs, CDs, CD cleaners and floppy disks.

"We expect the shares to have the potential to edge up a bit further in view of their grey market price but any further sharp rise is unlikely because the shares will be fully valued at that level," said Michael Ng, analyst at ASG Investment.
